patterns: Hey there
Hello, how are you?
Hi, I need help
Good morning!
Good afternoon, can you assist me?
responses: Hello! How can I assist you with your health concerns today?

patterns: Bye for now
Goodbye, thanks
See you later
Talk to you later
responses: Goodbye! Take care and consult a doctor if needed.

patterns: Who made you?
Who is your creator?
Who developed you?
Who created this chatbot?
responses: I was developed by Yasmine Berred (yb) as a medical assistant bot.

patterns: What can you do?
What are your functions?
How can you help me?
What are your capabilities?
responses: I analyze symptoms and suggest possible conditions. Always consult a doctor for proper diagnosis.

patterns: My nose is stuffy a
I'm sneezing a lot and my nose is running
I have itchy eyes and a runny nose
I'm sneezing and my nose feels congested
I have a skin rash or hives
My face or lips are swelling
I'm wheezing and coughing with chest tightness
I'm short of breath after being around something
I feel nauseous and vomited after eating something
responses: You may have an allergy. Try to avoid what causes the symptoms and see a doctor if it gets worse.

patterns: I'm always tired, weak, and dizzy with pale skin
I'm short of breath and my heart is racing
My hands and feet are cold and I get headaches
My nails are brittle and I have chest pain
I feel foggy and crave unusual things
My legs cramp and feel restless
responses: You are showing symptoms of anemia, possibly due to iron deficiency, vitamin B12 deficiency, or other causes. Consult a doctor for proper diagnosis.

patterns: I have a headache, body aches, and feel feverish
My nose is congested and runny
I'm sneezing, coughing, and my throat is sore
I'm tired and have mild chest discomfort
My eyes are watery and I can't taste much
I lost my sense of smell and my lymph nodes are swollen
responses: You are showing symptoms of a **cold** or **flu**. Rest, hydrate, and consider over-the-counter relief. If fever is high (>38.5°C/101°F) or breathing difficulties occur, seek medical help.

patterns: I'm short of breath and my chest feels tight
I hear a wheezing sound when I breathe
My coughing gets worse at night
I can barely speak and I'm breathing fast
I feel anxious because breathing is hard
I'm exhausted from struggling to breathe
responses: You are showing symptoms of asthma. Avoid triggers (dust, pollen, smoke), use prescribed inhalers if available, and seek medical attention if symptoms worsen or breathing becomes severely difficult.

patterns: I missed my period and my breasts are tender
I'm craving food and feel nauseous
I have morning sickness and pee a lot
I'm so tired and my mood is all over the place
I had lightnd my eyes are itchy and watery spotting and my sense of smell is stronger
I feel bloated and have mild pelvic cramps
responses: You are showing common early signs of pregnancy. Consider taking a home pregnancy test. For confirmation, schedule an appointment with a healthcare provider to begin prenatal care if positive.

patterns: My heart is racing and I'm sweating a lot
I can't stand heat and my hands are shaking
I'm nervous and agitated all the time
I'm tired but losing weight
My hair is thinning and falling out
I have muscle weakness and diarrhea
responses: You are showing classic symptoms of hyperthyroidism (overactive thyroid). This requires medical evaluation with blood tests (TSH, T3/T4). Untreated hyperthyroidism can lead to serious complications like heart problems or thyroid storm. Please consult a doctor promptly.

patterns: I'm exhausted, depressed, and gaining weight
I feel cold all the time and I'm sleepy
My skin is dry and feels coarse
I have muscle cramps and feel weak
I'm constipated and my hair is falling out
My nails are brittle and my voice is hoarse
responses: You are showing classic symptoms of hypothyroidism (underactive thyroid). This requires blood tests (TSH, T4) for diagnosis. Hypothyroidism is easily treatable with thyroid hormone replacement. Please see a doctor for evaluation.

patterns: I'm so thirsty and peeing all the time
I'm really hungry but losing weight
I'm tired and my vision is blurry
My wounds heal slowly
I keep getting infections and my mouth is dry
My hands are tingling and numb
responses: You are showing classic symptoms of diabetes. This requires urgent medical evaluation with blood glucose testing (fasting sugar or HbA1c). Untreated diabetes can lead to dangerous complications. Please see a doctor within 24-48 hours.

patterns: I have a severe headache and feel dizzy
I'm short of breath and my vision is blurred
I get nosebleeds and there's blood in my urine
I'm tired, confused, and have chest pain
My ears are buzzing and my heartbeat is irregular
My face is flushed and I can't sleep
responses: You are showing potentially dangerous symptoms of severe hypertension (high blood pressure). This requires IMMEDIATE medical attention as it may indicate hypertensive crisis (>180/120 mmHg) which can lead to stroke or organ damage. Call emergency services if experiencing chest pain/severe headache.

patterns: I have a high fever and swollen lymph nodes
I'm really tired and have a rash
My muscles and joints hurt and my throat is sore
I have mouth ulcers and night sweats
I'm getting chills, headaches, and diarrhea
I'm losing weight fast and have chronic diarrhea
responses: You are showing symptoms that may indicate acute HIV infection (especially if recent exposure within 2-6 weeks). URGENT testing is required - modern HIV treatments can prevent progression to AIDS if started early. Seek immediate medical care for PEP (post-exposure prophylaxis) if exposure occurred <72 hours ago.

patterns: My heart is racing out of nowhere
I have chest pain and can't breathe well
I'm trembling, shaking, and sweating
I feel like I'm choking and nauseous
I'm dizzy and lightheaded
My hands are numb and I'm terrified
responses: You're experiencing symptoms of a panic attack. While frightening, these episodes are not life-threatening. Try slow breathing (4-7-8 technique: inhale 4s, hold 7s, exhale 8s) and grounding exercises (name 5 things you see). Seek medical evaluation to rule out cardiac causes, especially if first episode.

patterns: My bone hurts all the time and it's swollen
I have tenderness and unexplained fractures
I feel a lump and I'm losing weight
I'm tired and my joints don't move well
I'm numb, weak, and have a fever
responses: You are showing concerning symptoms of possible bone pathology. These symptoms REQUIRE urgent orthopedic evaluation with imaging (X-ray/MRI) and possibly biopsy. While most bone lesions are benign, early detection of malignant tumors significantly improves outcomes.

patterns: I have a fever and chills that come and go
I get severe headaches, nausea, and vomiting
I'm sweating a lot and feel exhausted
My muscles and joints hurt and my stomach aches
I have diarrhea, anemia, and jaundice
I'm confused and might have cerebral malaria
responses: You are showing classic symptoms of malaria. This is a MEDICAL EMERGENCY if you've been in a malaria-endemic area recently. Immediate testing (blood smear/RDT) and treatment are required - severe malaria can be fatal within 24 hours. Seek care NOW if you have any fever after tropical travel.

patterns: I have a high fever and a bad headache
My muscles and joints are aching
I'm nauseous, vomiting, and have a rash
I'm bleeding a little and feel tired
My glands are swollen and my stomach hurts
I keep vomiting and there's bleeding
responses: You are showing symptoms of dengue fever. This requires URGENT medical attention if you've been in a dengue-endemic area. Watch for warning signs of severe dengue (hemorrhagic fever) - these appear 3-7 days after first symptoms and REQUIRE IMMEDIATE HOSPITALIZATION. Hydrate frequently and avoid NSAIDs (use paracetamol only).

patterns: I'm really tired and have no appetite
I'm nauseous, vomiting, and have jaundice
My skin is yellow and my urine is dark
My stools are clay-colored and my stomach hurts
My joints ache and I have a fever and itching
My liver feels tender and I'm confused
responses: You are showing classic symptoms of Hepatitis B infection. This requires URGENT medical evaluation with blood tests (HBsAg, liver function tests). Acute HBV can become chronic if untreated, leading to cirrhosis/liver cancer. Practice strict precautions to prevent transmission (blood/body fluids). Vaccination is available for contacts.

patterns: My nail area is red, swollen, and painful
There's pus and it's warm to the touch
My nail folds keep getting inflamed
My nails are crinkled with ridges
My nail is green and separating
My cuticle is missing
responses: You're showing symptoms of paronychia (nail fold infection). For acute cases: Soak in warm water 3-4x daily, avoid nail biting. If pus present or symptoms persist >48 hours, seek medical care for possible drainage/antibiotics. Chronic cases require identifying/treating underlying causes (eczema, diabetes).

patterns: I have persistent pain in my upper stomach
I'm losing weight for no reason
I have no appetite and have jaundice
My urine is dark and my stools are pale
I got diabetes recently and feel nauseous
My stools are oily and float, and I'm tired
responses: You are showing concerning symptoms that may indicate pancreatic cancer. These require URGENT medical evaluation with imaging (CT/MRI) and tumor marker tests (CA19-9). Early detection significantly improves outcomes. Seek immediate attention if jaundice or persistent pain develops, especially with weight loss.

patterns: I have a fever and an itchy rash with red spots
I have fluid-filled blisters that crust over
I'm tired, have a headache, and no appetite
The rash is on my face, chest, and spreading
I have a rash on my scalp, mouth, and genitals
My rash has spots, blisters, and crusts at once
responses: You're showing classic symptoms of chickenpox (varicella). ISOLATE immediately - highly contagious until all blisters crust. Use calamine lotion/cool baths for itching. Avoid scratching to prevent scarring. Seek URGENT care if: high fever >39°C, breathing difficulty, rash near eyes, or confusion develops.

patterns: My skin and eyes are turning yellow
I'm not feeding well and feel lethargic
I have a high-pitched cry
I'm floppy or stiff
I'm arching my back and have a fever or seizures
responses: This baby is showing symptoms of significant neonatal jaundice that may indicate dangerous bilirubin levels. This is a MEDICAL EMERGENCY - untreated high bilirubin can cause permanent brain damage (kernicterus). Seek IMMEDIATE pediatric evaluation with bilirubin testing. Breastfeed frequently (10-12x/day) to help excretion.

patterns: I have frequent loose, watery stools
My stomach is cramping and I feel urgent
I'm bloated, nauseous, and vomiting
I have a low-grade fever and feel unwell
My mouth is dry and my eyes look sunken
I'm not peeing much and feel dizzy
responses: You're experiencing acute diarrhea. Priority is rehydration - drink oral rehydration solutions (ORS) frequently. Eat bland foods (BRAT diet: Bananas, Rice, Applesauce, Toast). Seek medical care if: dehydration signs appear, symptoms persist >2 days, or if you see blood in stool. Avoid anti-diarrheals initially in infectious cases.

patterns: I feel discomfort in my upper stomach
I feel full quickly when eating
I'm bloated, nauseous, and vomiting
I'm burping and have heartburn
I'm losing weight and have trouble swallowing
I'm anemic and my family has a history of cancer
responses: You're showing symptoms of dyspepsia (indigestion). Try eating smaller meals, avoiding triggers (fatty/spicy foods, caffeine), and elevating your head at night. If symptoms persist >2 weeks or you develop alarm features (weight loss, vomiting blood), seek medical evaluation to rule out ulcers or other conditions.

patterns: I have few bowel movements and hard stools
I'm straining and feel incomplete evacuation
My lower stomach feels uncomfortable
I have anal fissures and bleeding
I'm bloated and uncomfortable
responses: You're showing symptoms of constipation. Increase fiber intake (25-30g/day), drink more water, and exercise regularly. Seek medical care if: symptoms persist >3 weeks, you see blood in stool, or experience unexplained weight loss.

patterns: I have pain around my belly button moving to the right
I have no appetite, feel nauseous, and am vomiting
I have a fever and pain when I press my stomach
My stomach hurts when I walk
It hurts when I cough
responses: You're showing RED FLAG symptoms of appendicitis. This is a SURGICAL EMERGENCY - go to ER immediately. Do not eat/drink or take painkillers until evaluated.

patterns: I'm worrying too much and feel restless
I'm tired and can't focus
I'm irritable and my muscles are tense
I can't sleep and have panic attacks
responses: You're showing symptoms of generalized anxiety disorder. Consider relaxation techniques and CBT. Seek professional help if: symptoms persist >6 months and impair daily functioning.

patterns: I have chronic bloody diarrhea
My lower right stomach hurts
I'm losing weight and feel tired
I have perianal lesions or fistulas
I have arthritis or eye inflammation
responses: You're showing concerning symptoms of Crohn's disease. This requires gastroenterology evaluation with colonoscopy and imaging. Untreated IBD increases cancer risk.

patterns: I'm excessively sleepy during the day
I have sudden sleep attacks or muscle weakness
I experience sleep paralysis or hallucinations
My nighttime sleep is fragmented
responses: You're showing hallmark symptoms of narcolepsy. This requires sleep study (polysomnography + MSLT) for diagnosis. Stimulants and scheduled naps help manage symptoms.

patterns: I have sharp pain in my side or lower back
I see blood in my urine and keep getting UTIs
I'm nauseous and vomiting during pain attacks
I've passed kidney stones before
responses: You're showing symptoms of cystinuria (inherited stone disorder). Increase fluid intake (>3L/day), alkalinize urine, and see urology for 24h urine testing and thiol drugs.

patterns: I have pain in my pelvic area or lower back
It hurts to pee and I go a lot at night
I have fever and pain during ejaculation
responses: You're showing prostatitis symptoms. Acute bacterial cases need prompt antibiotics. Chronic cases may require alpha-blockers, anti-inflammatories, and pelvic floor therapy.

patterns: I feel pressure in my chest
Pain spreads to my left arm or jaw
Pain starts with exercise and stops with rest
I'm short of breath and sweating
responses: You're showing classic angina symptoms suggesting coronary artery disease. STOP ACTIVITY. Use nitroglycerin if prescribed. Call EMS if pain persists >15 minutes (possible MI).

patterns: I have a fever and headache
I have muscle aches and a rash
My neck is stiff and I might have meningitis
I'm confused and have paralysis
responses: You're showing possible West Nile symptoms. Seek IMMEDIATE care for neurological signs (confusion, weakness). No specific treatment - supportive care only. Prevent mosquito bites.

patterns: My skin is red, swollen, and has pus
I have a high fever and chills
My heart is racing and I'm hypotensive
I'm confused and might have sepsis
responses: EMERGENCY: This may indicate invasive staph infection or sepsis. Seek IMMEDIATE medical care. Do not delay treatment.

patterns: My central vision is blurry
Lines look distorted and I can't read well
I have trouble recognizing faces
I see dark spots in my vision
responses: Schedule urgent ophthalmology evaluation. Use Amsler grid for self-monitoring. AREDS supplements may help dry AMD.

patterns: I see sudden flashes and floaters
It feels like a curtain over my vision
My peripheral vision is failing
responses: RETINAL EMERGENCY - requires evaluation within 24 hours to prevent permanent vision loss. Do not wait.

patterns: I'm losing my peripheral vision
I have tunnel vision and eye pain
My eyes are red and I see halos around lights
My optic nerve feels affected
responses: Acute angle-closure is MEDICAL EMERGENCY. Chronic glaucoma requires regular IOP monitoring and lifelong treatment.

patterns: I feel pelvic pressure and have incontinence
I have back pain and bleeding from fibroids
My uterus feels like it's protruding
responses: Consult gynecology for pelvic exam and ultrasound. Hysterectomy is one of several treatment options available.

patterns: I have thick white discharge
My vulva is itchy and red
It burns when I pee and sex hurts
responses: OTC antifungals (clotrimazole) often effective. Seek care if: recurrent (>4x/year), pregnant, or immunocompromised.

patterns: I'm scared of gaining weight and my BMI is low
I hate my body and haven't had my period
I have fine hair on my body and feel cold
My heart feels irregular
responses: EMERGENT: This life-threatening disorder requires multidisciplinary care (psychiatry + nutrition + medicine).

patterns: I'm short of breath and coughing a lot
I wheeze and my chest looks barrel-shaped
My lips are blue and I have frequent flare-ups
responses: Requires spirometry for diagnosis. Smoking cessation critical. Vaccinate against flu/pneumonia. Use inhalers as prescribed.

patterns: I'm short of breath when I exert myself
My breath sounds are weak
My chest is hyperinflated and I'm losing weight
responses: Pulmonary rehab improves outcomes. Oxygen if hypoxemic. Surgical options (LVRS) in select cases.

patterns: I have painful nodules with pus
I have abscesses in my armpit or groin
I have a fever and the boil is on my face
responses: Apply warm compresses 3-4x/day. Do NOT squeeze. Seek care if: fever develops, size >5cm, or facial location.

patterns: I have raised, shiny scars
My scars grow beyond the wound
My scars are dark, painful, and itchy
responses: Early intervention with silicone sheets/injections improves outcomes. Surgical excision often recurs without adjuvant therapy.

patterns: My face is flushed and red
I have pus-filled bumps and visible blood vessels
My nose skin is thickening
responses: You're showing classic rosacea symptoms. Avoid triggers (alcohol, spicy foods). Use gentle skincare and consult a dermatologist for prescription treatments.

patterns: I have a burning, tingling rash
The rash is on one side with fluid blisters
I'm very sensitive and have a fever
responses: URGENT: Shingles requires antiviral medication within 72 hours of rash appearance. Seek immediate medical care to prevent complications.

patterns: I have white or yellow flakes on my scalp
My scalp is itchy with scaly patches
My eyebrows and nose are flaky
responses: Use medicated anti-dandruff shampoos (containing zinc pyrithione or ketoconazole). See a doctor if redness/spreading occurs.

patterns: I have blackheads, whiteheads, and pimples
My nodules are painful and my skin is oily
I have acne on my chin, forehead, and back
responses: Clean skin gently twice daily. Avoid picking. Over-the-counter benzoyl peroxide helps. Severe cases need dermatology care.

patterns: I have rough, flesh-colored bumps
I see black pinpoints on my hands or fingers
responses: Most warts resolve in 2 years. Salicylic acid treatments help. Freezing (cryotherapy) by a doctor is faster.

patterns: My skin is thickening and tightening
My fingers turn white in the cold and I have red spots
My joints hurt
responses: This autoimmune condition requires rheumatology evaluation. Early treatment prevents organ damage.

patterns: I have purple, itchy bumps
I have white patches on my wrists and ankles
My mouth and nails are changing
responses: Topical corticosteroids often help. Oral lesions need monitoring for cancer risk.

patterns: I'm forgetting things and feel confused
I get lost with time, place, or tasks
My personality is changing
responses: Schedule a cognitive evaluation. Early diagnosis of Alzheimer's/dementia allows better management.

patterns: I have raised, red welts on my skin
I'm itching a lot and have swelling
My lips or eyelids are swollen for hours
responses: Antihistamines provide relief. Seek emergency care if throat swelling or breathing difficulty occurs.

patterns: I binge eat and then purge
I vomit or use laxatives and my teeth are eroding
My cheeks are swollen and my electrolytes are off
responses: This life-threatening eating disorder requires psychiatric + nutritional care. Confidential help is available.
